block.p: Susan Margaret Benveniste, a daughter of Karen Benveniste and Dr. Ronald J. Benveniste of Tacoma, Wash., was married yesterday to Keith Michael Walter, a son of Jean Sposato of Pelham, N.Y., and the late Winston J. Walter. The Rev. Thomas R. Murphy, a Roman Catholic priest, performed a ceremony that combined Roman Catholic and Jewish traditions at the Seattle Yacht Club.

Mrs. Walter, 33, is the marketing director for Skittles candy at M&M/Mars Inc. in Hackettstown, N.J. She graduated from the University of Washington and received an M.B.A. degree from Georgetown University. Her father, an ear, nose and throat specialist, practices in Tacoma. Her mother is a former coordinator for the Center for Childhood Safety at the Mary Bridge Hospital and Health Center, also in Tacoma.

Susan Margaret Benveniste, a daughter of Karen Benveniste and Dr. Ronald J. Benveniste of Tacoma, Wash., was married yesterday to Keith Michael Walter, a son of Jean Sposato of Pelham, N.Y., and the late Winston J. Walter. The Rev. Thomas R. Murphy, a Roman Catholic priest, performed a ceremony that combined Roman Catholic and Jewish traditions at the Seattle Yacht Club.

Mrs. Walter, 33, is the marketing director for Skittles candy at M&M/Mars Inc. in Hackettstown, N.J. She graduated from the University of Washington and received an M.B.A. degree from Georgetown University. Her father, an ear, nose and throat specialist, practices in Tacoma. Her mother is a former coordinator for the Center for Childhood Safety at the Mary Bridge Hospital and Health Center, also in Tacoma.

Mr. Walter, 32, is a vice president, in New York, of Bank Julius Baer, a Swiss bank, and the manager of its United States bond fund. He graduated from Connecticut College. His father owned J. W. Walter & Company, a household appliances distributor in Garden City, N.Y. The bridegroom's stepfather, Anthony Sposato, owns the Fire-End and Croker Corporation, a distributor of fire protection equipment in Elmsford, N.Y.
